author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of the Tamil Nadu Cooperative Bank Employees Union drawn from Thanjavur, Nagapattinam, and Tiruvarur districts staging a protest in Thanjavur on Friday.— PHOTO: R.M. RAJARATHINAM

Members of the Tamil Nadu Cooperative Bank Employees Union from the central region staged an agitation here in support of their four-point charter of demands.

Their demands, among other things, included filling 6,000 vacancies, introduction of pension benefits to the employees, and regularisation of services of temporary employees. R. Govindan, secretary of the Thanjavur District Cooperative Employees Association, led the agitation. K. Balasubramanian, general secretary of Confederation of All India Government Employees’ Associations, spoke.
title: Co-operative bank staff protest, present four-point charter
